summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employee, a general maintenance worker at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the surrounding circumstances in August 2019. The employee is questioned about their role, knowledge of camera systems, and any awareness of issues or events related to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death in August 2019 at the MCC is the subject of the OIG investigation. The witness states she saw him on the SHU (Special Housing Unit) tier but had no direct interaction.

persons.name: Brianna Rose Burton
persons.context: Certified the transcript as an accurate representation of the electronic sound recording of the OIG interview proceedings.

events.title: Epstein found in cell / Camera issues reported
events.description: The date Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell. The document references a service request log indicating a technician ('T.R.') reported issues with the NICE Vision Pro camera system's RAID drives on August 8th and 9th, and attempted repairs on August 10th.

events.title: Epstein's death / Camera repair attempt
events.description: The date Jeffrey Epstein was discovered deceased in his cell at the MCC. A technician reportedly gained access to the DVR room to attempt to replace faulty camera system drives, which corrupted the video database.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP employee
events.description: The DOJ OIG conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP general maintenance employee at the MCC regarding the investigation into Epstein's death and surrounding circumstances, including camera system functionality.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
locations.context: The federal jail in New York, New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died. The interview is conducted on-site.

locations.name: Nine South (SHU)
locations.context: The Special Housing Unit tier within the MCC where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and where the witness states she saw him.

keyFacts: The interviewed BOP employee, a general maintenance worker, had no direct involvement with Jeffrey Epstein and claims no knowledge of camera system failures at the MCC in August 2019.

A service request log read during the interview details technical problems with the MCC's NICE Vision Pro camera system's RAID drives on August 8-10, 2019, including corrupted video data due to improper drive replacement during a rebuild.

The witness states that if a camera issue had been reported to her while she was acting supervisor, she would have escalated it to higher management (the AW or warden) and instructed it to be fixed immediately, not left for the next day.
The employee expresses no personal knowledge about the circumstances of Epstein's death, relying solely on media reports, and claims no one at the MCC ever discussed the incident with her afterward.
The document reveals a chain of responsibility for camera maintenance: Comtechs (Communications Technicians) report to the Facilities Manager, who reports to the Associate Warden (AW).
